Dispute_Type: Refusal of PRRA and H&C applications
Legal_Issue: Application of incorrect legal test for risk assessment in PRRA and H&C applications
Governing_Law: IRPA s. 112(1), s. 25(1), and exemption under s. 25(1.3) for H&C applications made before 2010
Evidence_Assessment: Officer disregarded evidence such as letters from pastors without explanation
Burden_of_Proof: Reasonable possibility standard required, but officer applied balance of probabilities
Legal_Rule: Officers must apply 'reasonable possibility' standard, not 'balance of probabilities' for risk assessment
Procedural_Issue: Flawed PRRA analysis impacting H&C decision, lack of explanation for disregarding evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Incorrect legal test applied, procedural unfairness
Outcome_on_Merits: Applications unreasonably denied due to legal error
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer failed to provide adequate reasoning for evidence dismissal
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged refusal of PRRA and H&C applications based on incorrect legal standard
Court_Result: Decisions annulled and remanded for reconsideration by a different officer
Outcome: Applications rejected initially; court ordered reassessment
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Perceived lack of evidence, failure to meet burden of proof under incorrect standard
Applicable_Process: PRRA and H&C application process, judicial review
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Reassessment of PRRA and H&C applications pending
Governing_Rule: Reasonable possibility standard for risk assessment in PRRA and pre-2010 H&C cases
